thread.title: Lincoln-Way North beats Lincoln-Way Central to stay unbeaten
thread.title_full: Lincoln-Way North beats Lincoln-Way Central to stay unbeaten

title: Lincoln-Way North beats Lincoln-Way Central to stay unbeaten
text:
Lincoln-Way North beats Lincoln-Way Central to stay unbeaten Published: Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015 1:04 a.m. CDT Caption (Lathan Goumas - lgoumas@shawmedia.com) Lincoln-Way Central's Bryan Ditchman returns a Lincoln-Way North fumble for a touchdown during the first half of a game Friday in New Lenox. North defeated Central, 45-18. By CURT HERRON – cherron @shawmedia.com 
NEW LENOX – Needing a win in order to clinch a playoff berth, Lincoln-Way Central put itself in a position to do just that on Friday by rallying from an 18-3 deficit to tie things at 18-18 late in the second quarter against unbeaten Lincoln-Way North. Related Links Minooka football stumbles at Oswego East, falls 17-8 
But the Phoenix responded to the threat by getting a long scoring drive just before the break and then returning the opening kickoff of the second half for a touchdown as they spoiled the Knights' senior night by capturing a 45-18 SouthWest Suburban Red victory. 
North (8-0, 6-0) capped a 12-play, 80-yard drive with a one-yard run by Joe Peters (24 rushes, 129 yards) on fourth and goal with eight seconds left in the half for a 25-18 lead. And then they received a 96-yard kick return from Colton Pedersen to open the final half. 
The Knights (4-4, 3-3), who must win at 7-1 Thornton next week, grabbed a 3-0 lead just 2:49 into the contest when Brock Krohe kicked a 29-yard field goal. But North responded with three straight scores, capped by a 45-yard interception return by Jimmy Vallos. 
Central, which was led by quarterback Austin Strilko (13 of 21, 129 yards), rallied with a 47-yard strike from Nolan Hayes to Ryan Foster on a halfback pass and then got a 30-yard fumble return from defensive lineman Bryan Ditchman within a span of just 20 seconds to tie things with 4:35 remaining in the half. 
North, which clinched a share of the SWSC Red title and hosts 7-1 Lincoln-Way West next week, got two more touchdowns in the third quarter to break things open. One was a long scoring pass from Jake Arthur (14 of 18, 207 yards) to Pat Troike (six catches, 116 yards) and the other was a sneak by Arthur.
